Findings include:Review of 109.23(b)(1-5) Written Nursing Care Policies revealed the facility continues to be out of compliance with this regulation.  The final anticipated completion date was February 23, 2023.The PoC stated "The Executive Vice President, Chief Nursing Officer for The Guthrie Clinic (acting interim Robert Packer Hospital (RPH) Chief Nursing Officer was responsible for this action plan.  To address the weight documentation deficiency, a "Daily Weight Audit Tool"  was created to monitor daily weight documentation.  The RPH 7 NW Nurse Manager would reinforce the importance of following orders related to daily weight documentation including how patient's weight was taken and any major discrepancies from previous weight documented with all 7 NW nursing staff during unit council meetings, daily huddles and "Weekly Updates" newsletter.  The RPH 7 NW Nurse Manager, or designee, would complete 30 daily weight documentation completion audits using the "Daily Weight Audit Tool" per month for 3 months or until 90% compliance was reached, then 30 daily weight documentation completion audits per quarter for 2 quarters to evaluate ongoing compliance.  The RPH 7 Main Nurse Manager would review any noncompliant findings with the staff involved.  Any trends identified would be addressed with the staff per the  progressive disciplinary process if appropriate.  Audits would be reported by the RPH 7 NW Nurse Manager at the next scheduled Nursing Clinical  Quality meeting.  The RPH Director of Clinical Regulatory Compliance would report audit compliance to the RPH Board Quality subcommittee meeting quarterly for the next 2 scheduled meetings.  All corrective actions would be completed prior to 2/23/2023."  Cross reference 109.23(b)(1-5) Written Nursing Care Policies Plan of Correction - To be completed: 10/14/20231.
